channel.title: Two Suggestions
channel.description:
-Make a rule about advertisement links in signature. We don't need a bunch of people linking to jdb's.
-I noticed that the Terms of Service is for the forums not the entire site/homepage. I believe the Terms of Service should cover the homepage as a Jagex employee could look at the mopar monthly on the homepage and be like "oh rs2 tutorials interesting, probable cause thanks!"

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Pretty sure 508 is supported, and I’m pretty sure there’s a standing offer on newer client-server pairs if they’re made to work with the Moparscape framework.
If this is still too limiting for people though then they should accept the reality that some malicious releases may be available to download until a moderator has the chance to intervene.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Lothy the problem with that is people want to play servers with newer revision content now. Not many still would play a real 317 anymore. I admit i have even leaned towards the 317 with the higher revision npc and items packed once or twice. Either way though, there is much more freedom using your own client as well. Even if some of them dont use it within decent morals.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

You know, there wouldn’t be as many tainted clients if people developed servers that made use of the Moparscape client.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

There are not any corrupt staff members here; maybe you have us confused with rune_server or sythe?

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:38, topic:520801”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=639311.msg4309353#msg4309353 date=1370479874]
I don’t even… HOW MANY TIMES CAN WE WRITE THE SAME ANSWER AND YOU STILL DON’T LISTEN.
[/quote]Seriously.[/quote]more direct approach sometimes works.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I don’t even… HOW MANY TIMES CAN WE WRITE THE SAME ANSWER AND YOU STILL DON’T LISTEN.

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:34, topic:520801”]-now let’s get a little more “home” shall we. Myth-Scape was a VERY popular server back in the late 2011-2012 era. 60 plus players got infected with a rat because of jack. Now…let’s fast forward a little more. it wasn’t until a month later did the moderators realize that jack still had his signature link to that very same infected website.[/quote]Action can only be taken once someone identifies an issue. If nobody reported his signature, how would mods know it was infected? What if something completely unrelated to advertising that would normally be allowed (say, a rs map editor or a source) was infected and nobody reported it. Is that still Moparscapes fault and they should ban all download links?

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

That’s not MoparScape’s fault. We support the development and advancing of the RuneScape private server scene. We also allow advertisements. How is it the moderation’s fault that someone came in and broke the rules? What are we trying to do, moderate everything? I think that that’s just too much to bare for a community.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

again, you are looking at it from the other side of the dice.

@uncalled, that’s just how ruby and I are you should had seen us in irc a while back lols

I also fail to see where all of you are making it sound like I am implying this is a major issue. I am just bringing up the fact itself that it is possible for this to happen. Let me give you a very good example well two of them actually…

-who can tell me why arrowz is banned? I’m sure if you have been in the r-s scene you know the very reason why.

-now let’s get a little more “home” shall we. Myth-Scape was a VERY popular server back in the late 2011-2012 era. 60 plus players got infected with a rat because of jack. Now…let’s fast forward a little more. it wasn’t until a month later did the moderators realize that jack still had his signature link to that very same infected website.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

I, for one, am more than willing to help stop the problem. But I’m not going to go around and look at every signature link that I see. If I have reason to believe that a file is suspicious, then I will go ahead and take a look at it. If it’s a virus, then I will report it immediately. There’s really no reason to fear to begin with, most of the viruses come from the Server Downloads section of the forums. Hardly is there anyone that puts viruses in their signatures. So, it seems to have a little redundancy to apply rules against it.

[quote=“Ruby, post:32, topic:520801”]Don’t spread complete bullshit, nothing here is corrupt. If you’re going to post something like that then YOU get your facts straight. If they get infected it IS NOT our fault, if we get a report of a virus them we will look into it in as much detail as possible and then take action, if people don’t report it we cant do that. You’re just arguing for the sake of arguing as you always do rather than actually facing the fact that you’re wrong.[/quote]You guys seem like you’re about to get into some flaming. I suggest you cool it.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Don’t spread complete bullshit, nothing here is corrupt. If you’re going to post something like that then YOU get your facts straight. If they get infected it IS NOT our fault, if we get a report of a virus them we will look into it in as much detail as possible and then take action, if people don’t report it we cant do that. You’re just arguing for the sake of arguing as you always do rather than actually facing the fact that you’re wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

@ruby the corrupt staff actually came out of another staff members mouth which I won’t mention on here for obvious reasons Please get your facts straight!

@ruby, uncalled, davidi2 you are using an analogy of free will with the knowledge that there is a chance you could kill somebody. Not every single person out there on mopar knows a diddly doop about jdb’s etc. And if you believe this then well …I feel bad for you.

A vast majority of the infected files come from one thing : greed. If you aren’t willing to help stop the problem then you are part of the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:29, topic:520801”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=639311.msg4309241#msg4309241 date=1370471010]
If Mopar is ALLOWING links to applets and if somebody else gets INFECTED cause of the link being ALLOWED in the first place then… technically it is mopars fault. That’s like saying the cake fell off the table for no reason.

Edit: Every mod I know claims they don’t have the manpower yet I don’t see them adding more manpower, not that I would blame anybody who was asked if they declined with the corrupt staff but hey!
[/quote]Think of it this way, police officers assume everyone driving has a drivers license.[/quote]Good analogy. Law says nobody can drive without the license, that doesn’t make it the governments fault if someone gets hurt from a person driving without a license. Same can be said about drunk driving as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:26, topic:520801”]If Mopar is ALLOWING links to applets and if somebody else gets INFECTED cause of the link being ALLOWED in the first place then… technically it is mopars fault. That’s like saying the cake fell off the table for no reason.

Edit: Every mod I know claims they don’t have the manpower yet I don’t see them adding more manpower, not that I would blame anybody who was asked if they declined with the corrupt staff but hey![/quote]Yes, true. Although, we do not allow malacious content. Think of it this way, police officers assume everyone driving has a drivers license. We allow advertising in our signatures, but we do not allow malacious content. We assume all links in signatures do not contain any malacious content.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:26, topic:520801”]If Mopar is ALLOWING links to applets and if somebody else gets INFECTED cause of the link being ALLOWED in the first place then… technically it is mopars fault. That’s like saying the cake fell off the table for no reason.[/quote]That is complete and utter bullshit. That’s the same reasoning people are using to try and take down file upload sites. “Well hurr durr if you don’t check every upload and something copyrighted gets put up and download that makes it your fault, even if you have rules that say not to upload copyrighted content.”

And about manpower: Nobody ever said we don’t have enough manpower right now, it was said that they don’t have enough manpower to try your batshit-crazy idea and have it be effective.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Not every mod claims anything about manpower, stop putting words in peoples mouths. I’ve never once claimed that. I’ve also never met a corrupt staff member here, so stop spreading complete shit. If these are your views then logout, it’s as simple as that. It’s worked for us for a good 6 coming on 7 years. We allow links to peoples sites, if they’re reported as malicious we’re going to check them out and take action on the outcome. I’ve helped you quite a few times through PM myself with what you thought infected clients so don’t even start on this bullshit. Stop manipulating peoples words and stop just complaining to be a pain in the ass. We allow links to peoples sites, that’s not us allowing links to malicious content so don’t make it out to be that.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

If Mopar is ALLOWING links to applets and if somebody else gets INFECTED cause of the link being ALLOWED in the first place then… technically it is mopars fault. That’s like saying the cake fell off the table for no reason.

Edit: Every mod I know claims they don’t have the manpower yet I don’t see them adding more manpower, not that I would blame anybody who was asked if they declined with the corrupt staff but hey!

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:24, topic:520801”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=639311.msg4309158#msg4309158 date=1370463267] If someone is going to be infected then that isn’t our fault because we allow them to advertise through us.
[/quote]ruby read that to yourself in your head please… LOL[/quote]What? If someone advertises a malicious website through us that the staff haven’t found yet then it isn’t our fault. If no-one reports it we can’t ban them. It isn’t our fault if someone is infected because they ran a bad applet.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:18, topic:520801”]If someone is going to be infected then that isn’t our fault because we allow them to advertise through us.[/quote]ruby read that to yourself in your head please… LOL

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Neither are a problem. All implementing these things would do is make it more inconvenient for the users of the site and give the staff more unneeded work to do.

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

I figured as much, but I couldn’t quite remember, as I haven’t been on this site for quite some time.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:19, topic:520801”]I do believe, though, that if one gets infected and reports it to a staff member, with proof, showing that it was in fact that specific file from that specific link; that member with the infected file in his signature should be in infracted with his signature removed. Something to that effect.[/quote]That’s basically what happens. Anyone caught using the forums as a way to infect people gets perm banned on the spot.

EDIT - Beaten by 30 seconds, mybad

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Uncalled:

I do believe, though, that if one gets infected and reports it to a staff member, with proof, showing that it was in fact that specific file from that specific link; that member with the infected file in his signature should be in infracted with his signature removed. Something to that effect.

Anyone found posting or linking to malicious content is banned as soon as found guilty, regardless of how they display it or spread it if its through this site they will be banned straight away.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

I do believe, though, that if one gets infected and reports it to a staff member, with proof, showing that it was in fact that specific file from that specific link; that member with the infected file in his signature should be in infracted with his signature removed. Something to that effect.
